definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to start a match/to kick off

sentences.english: Dr Kraabel began as an editor with the Edanz Group in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 2008年開始爲理文編輯工作，擔任編輯。

sentences.english: Is your focus on productivity starting to make you feel miserable or stressed out?
sentences.chinese: 如果你追求效能時開始感到痛苦或是精疲力竭？

sentences.english: The local store has started selling baguettes and Belgian beers.
sentences.chinese: 當地的商店已經開始出售法國棍式麪包和比利時啤酒。

sentences.english: But in the third week of May, currents drew some of the oil southeast.
sentences.chinese: 但到了5月的第三週，洋流開始把浮油帶向東南方向。

sentences.english: The Grain Budding shows that crops that will ripen in summer start to show plump seeds.
sentences.chinese: 小滿表示在夏季成熟的農作物籽粒開始飽滿了。

sentences.english: Yu from East Jiangzhou down to the Three Gorges, Three Gorges will begin dredging project.
sentences.chinese: 禹從江州東下來到了三峽，便開始疏浚三峽的工程。

sentences.english: He started to unbutton his pants.
sentences.chinese: 他開始解褲子上的鈕釦。

sentences.english: Before I got these, my allergies would turn into weeks-long sinus infections.
sentences.chinese: 在我開始使用前，過敏症狀已變成持續幾周的鼻炎。

sentences.english: She clicks on the link to the registration form and begins entering her information.
sentences.chinese: 她在登記表的連接處點擊一下，開始進入她的信息。

sentences.english: During Hellenistic times, Greek women also started to artificially wave and curl their hair.
sentences.chinese: 在希臘化時代期間，希臘女人就已開始人爲地捲髮了。

sentences.english: The press began to lionize him enthusiastically.
sentences.chinese: 媒體開始狂熱地吹捧他。

sentences.english: GLO started the sponsorship of the Confederation of African Football African Player of the Year Award.
sentences.chinese: 格洛開始贊助的非洲足球聯合會非洲年度最佳球員。

sentences.english: What advice do you have for anyone looking to start a collection of single malts ?
sentences.chinese: 你對那些想開始收藏單麥芽威士忌的人有何建議？

sentences.english: Once fastening bolts, each bolt to ensure that the force evenly.
sentences.chinese: 一旦開始緊固螺栓，要確保各個螺栓均勻受力。

sentences.english: Ever since she was six years old, Loryn has yearned to visit India.
sentences.chinese: 從六歲開始，洛恩就嚮往遊覽印度。

sentences.english: The agreement needed to be in place prior to commencing the work.
sentences.chinese: 協議需要在工作開始之前就到位。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
